pr_title: 5439: InProcessTransport optionally adds causal information to status

timeline.message: inprocess,internal: add ability to pass status cause to client

timeline.bodyText: nit: We normally don't set the field explicitly to its default, because it is just noisy. It is fine, though, and no need to change.
timeline.author: ejona86

replies.bodyText: Will avoid this in the future 🙂
replies.author: reggiemcdonald

timeline.bodyText: Add an empty line before the @ parts of the javadoc.
timeline.author: ejona86

timeline.bodyText: It is generally helpful to include some language about what the purpose of the method is. In this case we could say this is intended to make test failures more clear and easier to debug. We can also note that the default is to strip the cause for consistency with other transports. The cause information can normally leak information to untrusted clients and is language-specific, which aren't concerns for in-process.
timeline.author: ejona86

replies.bodyText:
Good point 🙂
I added some documentation.
replies.author: reggiemcdonald

timeline.bodyText:
Hmm... The name is a bit awkward. It seems hard to figure out a good name here. Options I thought of:
propagateStatusCause
communicateStatusCause
propagateCauseWithStatus (inspired by the includeCauseWithStatus)
Dunno...
timeline.author: ejona86

replies.bodyText:
I struggled with this also. I really think propagateCauseWithStatus is the most descriptive!
Also it follows nicely with the field name
replies.author: reggiemcdonald

timeline.bodyText: Since InProcessTransport is package-private, we don't have to preserve the old constructor. Delete it?
timeline.author: ejona86

timeline.bodyText: This doesn't appear used. Please delete it.
timeline.author: ejona86

timeline.bodyText: We'd like this to be final if we can. I see it is mutated for testing. But I think we can make some tweaks to avoid that. I'll comment on the tests.
timeline.author: ejona86

timeline.bodyText:
Note that this comment doesn't matter if the test gets reworked.
The implementation of this method in InProcessTransport is pretty straight-forward; you can just copy it here. Alternatively you can make a new protected method in InProcessTransport, newClientTransport(InternalServer server, boolean includeStatusWithCause) and call it here. Both options seem pretty fair and allow us to always pass includeStatusWithCause in the constructor.
(When the number of arguments gets out of hand, we actually have a pattern to make that cleaner by passing in the builder/transportFactory to the constructor, and letting the constructor grab the things it needs. But it's not a big enough problem here yet to force you to rework that.)
timeline.author: ejona86
ejona86

replies.author: reggiemcdonald

timeline.message:
inprocess: improve javadocs and method name for InProcessChannelBuilder.propagateCauseWithStatus

Addresses comment in PR to change method name tranportIncludeStatusCause to something more descriptive: propagateCauseWithStatus. Updates javadoc to better describe what the propagateCauseWithStatus setting does - including the default behaviour of the method.

inprocess: remove unused method

Addressing PR feedback, this commit removes the getter from InProcessTransport that is not used in the codebase.

inprocess, internal: creates single test to check for propagating cause with status

To address a PR comment, this commit makes the includeCauseWithStatus field of the InProcessTransport final, and adds a single test case to verify that the cause is propagated properly when configured. The field server of AbstractTransportTest had to be made protected so that it could be nullified in the test case for the after each hook.

timeline.bodyText: Deleting these lines concerns me. Is this necessary?
timeline.author: ejona86

replies.bodyText: You're right, not necessary! I will add the assertion back in
replies.author: reggiemcdonald

timeline.message:
internal: Add back assertnull assertion for server status

This commit addresses PR feedback by adding back a null assertion. Default behaviour for transports is to strip cause from status. So in AbstractTransportTest.clientCancel, server status should have a null cause.

timeline.bodyText: The method name, the argument, and the javadoc do not match.
timeline.author: dapengzhang0

replies.bodyText: Not quite sure what you mean. Where is the discrepancy?
replies.author: reggiemcdonald

replies.bodyText: I think he's referring to where it says "but stripped of any other information (i.e. cause)"
replies.author: ejona86

replies.bodyText:
Where is the discrepancy?

The method name says "strip cause"
The javadoc says "strip something, i.e. cause"
The new argument says "do not strip cause if true".
replies.author: dapengzhang0

replies.bodyText: Ok gotcha. I'll update the javadoc and method name
replies.author: reggiemcdonald

timeline.message:
inprocess: rename InProccessTransport.stripCause to InProcessTransport.cleanStatus and update javadoc

This commit addresses PR feedback by renaming InProcessTransport.stripCause to InProcessTransport.cleanStatus and updating the javadoc, to better reflect the fact that the status can now optionally include cause.
